intro: Salomonia arnottiana, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, often blooming during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value and unique flowering season contribute to its appeal in horticultural settings.
